title: DOD Is Updating Its Decade-Old Autonomous Weapons Policy, but Confusion Remains Widespread
description: The U.S. Department of Defense (DOD) is planning to update its autonomous weapons policy. Given misconceptions about what the decade-old policy says, this is an opportunity for improving clarity among DOD technology research and development organizations.

title: Intellectual Property Protection and Open Academic Exchange: Striking the Proper Balance
description: As U.S. technology competition with China accelerates, the United States will face a difficult balancing act between promoting openness with securing intellectual property.

title: The Longer-Term Impact of the Ukraine Conflict and the Growing Importance of the Civil Side of War
description: The conflict in Ukraine is a warning that the civil side of war is becoming far more dangerous, writes CSIS’s Emeritus Chair in Strategy.

title: The Evening: Russia Controls 20%, Saudi Oil Boost, CSNY, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Russia Controls 20%, Saudi Oil Boost, CSNY, and More.

title: Reshoring Semiconductors with the Chips Act: Key Lessons from Albany, New York
description: In terms of reshoring U.S. chip production, the state of New York’s recent, successful effort to establish world-class semiconductor research and manufacturing capabilities in the area around Albany offers important perspectives.

title: Downside of High Prices: Five Trends in Global Gas
description: The U.S. LNG export industry is booming. But, as discussed at last week’s World Gas Conference in South Korea, high prices, extreme price volatility, and concerns about carbon intensity pose big challenges for global gas.

title: China Gears Up to Launch Its Third Aircraft Carrier
description: China is gearing up to launch its largest, most advanced aircraft carrier, the Type 003. Satellite imagery from May 31 shows the dry dock housing the carrier has been cleared of other shipbuilding projects, leaving an open path for the vessel to enter the Yangtze River.

title: Save the Last Dance for the International Space Station
description: Following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, space ties between Russia and the United States have shown signs of unraveling.

title: Strengthening a Transnational Semiconductor Industry
description: Semiconductors are a key component of national power. U.S. policy should seek to increase reliability and trust in supply, reinforce all elements of chip-making capacity, and reduce China’s role in the supply chain.

title: Encryption Security for a Post Quantum World
description: A quantum computer of sufficient sophistication would threaten much of the encryption used today. This post explores the foundations of encryption, the potential threat of quantum computers, and offers lessons from a prior encryption transition for a post quantum world.

title: The Evening: Rockets to Ukraine, Taiwan Trade, Bertha, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Rockets to Ukraine, Taiwan Trade, Bertha, and More.

title: Russia’s Ill-Fated Invasion of Ukraine: Lessons in Modern Warfare
description: Russia failed to achieve its main political and military objectives in Ukraine because of poor military planning, significant logistical problems, low combat readiness, and other deficiencies. These challenges will be difficult for the Russian military to fix quickly.
